Content:
I hate that we're back in the circle now....
the total irony is that all of this is over shares that per node amount to less than I spend on 🚬 but somehow are "undeserved" by a hashrate that dwarfs any major farm
to that end I support abolishment, I was just pointing out that the hope for rewards are what keep many miners mining (even though most of them are unaware that they have almost no chance of getting them any more)
`there is no luck because of "gigapool" `
**and** hunting pool combined
have a look at the numbers and you'll see that before the "hunting pool" existed the average miner's chance was significantly higher than present

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the numbers showed that before the sniping, notaries were getting close to the expected amounts. the sniping pool really skewed things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i knew how to hunt for blocks, years ago, but i felt it best to leave it to random chance

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: once an external party started sniping, it upset the balance and the 75% wasnt 75% anymore

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: who is blaming the pool

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just explaining that once external miner starts sniping, if the NN dont start doing the same, they end up with less than the targeted 75%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and NN sniping is also allowed by the rules

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if it isnt pooled, i estimated 10 or so NN would end up hunting and that would make  a significant change from the existing balance. would it be any harm? probably not, but it would be a change and it was safer to minimize the change to the overall balance
